intro: Asclepias swynnertonii, commonly known as the Swynnerton's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces distinctive seed pods that contain spiral-shaped seeds attached to silky filaments, aiding in wind dispersal. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Asclepias swynnertonii is also noted for its ecological importance, providing nectar for various pollinators.
